intro: Hymenasplenium phamhoanghoi, commonly known as the Phamhoanghoi spleenwort, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow foliage and small, clustered sporangia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure includes a thallus with distinct leaf-like structures and a central stem. Hymenasplenium phamhoanghoi plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitat.
